results.title: The Mysteries of Ludwig Leicheart
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the historical journey across the Top End made by Ludwig Leicheart and his horse Rusty. They eat and sleep and upon waking, Leicheart gets attacked and killed by a dingo. Leicheart’s trusty horse avenges his master’s death by killing the dingo.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Land is me
results.brief_description: In addition to writing and singing the theme song, 10 year old Shannon scripted, animated and helped edit this short film about the impact of early Australian settlement on Aboriginal cultures. Overall Winner of the Screen It! competition 2004. An animated short entered to “Create a moving image work on the theme ‘Pacific Explorer” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Great Sea Explorer
results.brief_description:
The story of Matthew Flinders and his journey to Australia. After leaving his family in England, Flinders sets off to sea, and after many years travelling to and around Australia, he returns home. His heroic journey is rewarded by the Queen with a house as a gift for his exploration achievements.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: A Day in the Life of Captain Cook
results.brief_description:
A reenactment of Captain Cook and his crew hitting land after a treacherous arrival to a new island, later named Botany Bay.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Modern Discoveries
results.brief_description:
A girl daydreams in class, thinking about people’s experiences of coming to Australia as well as her future desire to travel the world. Includes her thoughts about faraway societies.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Who Killed Target 1967?
results.brief_description: A vengeful female scientist, outraged by Godard’s victimisation of Anna Karina, constructs a beautiful female robot to seduce and destroy lovers attracted solely by physical beauty.

results.title: Marsupial memories
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
Allan Vaughan tells the story of a funny looking stuffed kangaroo housed at the Murtoa museum. He recalls how, as a child, he used to visit the kangaroo when it was a pet belonging to his uncle. He tells how his uncle used to box with this kangaroo and also relates the story of how the animal came to end up as a taxidermic display.

results.title: Dispensing a cure
results.brief_description: One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region. Ian Darling and Doug McColl have each practised pharmacy for over forty years in the Warracknabeal district. In this film they recall the era when most drugs were hand-made on the premises, generally from raw materials. Ian also tells of the mysterious medicine jar labelled ‘ADT’ and of an old-fashioned coin-operated machine for a self administered electric shock.

results.title: A Bulldog man
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
Lanz Bulldog tractors have been a big part of life in the Bolwell family since the 1930’s. Tim Bolwell has inherited his father’s collection of almost 30 Bulldog tractors, as well as an encyclopedic knowledge of the history and mechanics of these unusual machines. In this film, Tim explains the attraction of the Bulldog and its historical importance for many farmers in the Wimmera region.
